docs.title: Examples

docs.text: Use this endpoint to delete a post created by the authenticated author. Useful for removing outdated or incorrect posts.
docs.title: When to Use

docs.text: Send a DELETE request to the endpoint with the AUTHOR_ID and POST_ID in the URL. The user must be authenticated as the author of the post.
docs.title: How to Use

docs.text: This endpoint soft-deletes the post by setting its visibility to "DELETED". The post is no longer visible but remains in the database.
docs.title: Why to Use

docs.text: URL Parameters : AUTHOR_ID : UUID of the author (e.g., 123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000 ). POST_ID : UUID of the post (e.g., 123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174001 ).
docs.title: Request

docs.text: Status Code : 204 No Content (success), 403 Forbidden (unauthorized user), 404 Not Found (post not found).
docs.title: Response

docs.text: Successful Deletion : curl -X DELETE http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/authors/123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000/posts/123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174001/ -H "Authorization: Token <auth_token>" Response: { "detail": "Post Deleted." } Unauthorized User : curl -X DELETE http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/authors/123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000/posts/123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174001/ Response: { "detail": "Authentication credentials were not provided." }
docs.title: Examples

docs.text: Use this endpoint to update the content of a post. Useful for correcting typos or updating information.
docs.title: When to Use

docs.text: Send a PUT request to the endpoint with the AUTHOR_ID and POST_ID in the URL. Include the updated post data in the request body. The user must be authenticated as the author of the post.
docs.title: How to Use

docs.text: To modify an existing post without deleting and recreating it.
docs.title: Why to Use

docs.text: URL Parameters : AUTHOR_ID : UUID of the author (e.g., 123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000 ). POST_ID : UUID of the post (e.g., 123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174001 ). Body : { "content": "Updated Post", }
docs.title: Request

docs.text: Status Code : 200 OK (success), 400 Bad Request (invalid data), 403 Forbidden (unauthorized user), 404 Not Found (post not found). Body : { "id": "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/authors/123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000/posts/123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174001", "content": "Updated Post", }
docs.title: Response

docs.text: Successful Update : curl -X PUT http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/authors/123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000/posts/123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174001/ -H "Authorization: Token <auth_token>" -H "contentType: text/plain" -d '{"text": "Updated Post"}' Invalid Data : curl -X PUT http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/authors/123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000/posts/123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174001/ -H "Authorization: Token <auth_token>" -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"text": ""}' Response: { "text": ["This field may not be blank."] }
docs.title: Examples

docs.text: Use this endpoint to retrieve all posts by a specific author. Useful for displaying a user's profile or feed.
docs.title: When to Use

docs.text: Send a GET request to the endpoint with the AUTHOR_ID in the URL. Pagination is supported using query parameters ( page and size ).
docs.title: How to Use

docs.text: To fetch a list of posts for display or analysis.
docs.title: Why to Use

docs.text: URL Parameters : AUTHOR_ID : UUID of the author (e.g., 123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000 ). Query Parameters : page : Page number (default: 1 ). size : Number of posts per page (default: 10 ).
docs.title: Request

docs.text: Status Code : 200 OK (success), 404 Not Found (author not found). Body : { "type":"posts", "page_number":1, "size":10, "count": 9001, "src":[ { "type":"post", "title":"plain text post", "id":"http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/authors/123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000/posts/123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174001", "page": "http://127.0.0.1:8000/authors/123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000/posts/123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174001", "description":"plain text post", "contentType":"text/plain", "content":"Test Post", "author":{ "type":"author", "id":"http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/authors/123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000", "host":"http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/", "displayName":"Test User", "page":"http://127.0.0.1:8000/authors/123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000", "github": "https://github.com/testuser", "profileImage": "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/authors/123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000/posts/123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174010/image" }, "published":"2015-03-09T13:07:04+00:00", "visibility":"PUBLIC" }, { "type":"post", /* ... the rest of the post object */ }, { "type":"post", /* ... the rest of the post object */ }, { "type":"post", /* ... the rest of the post object */ }, { "type":"post", /* ... the rest of the post object */ }, { "type":"post", /* ... the rest of the post object */ }, { "type":"post", /* ... the rest of the post object */ }, { "type":"post", /* ... the rest of the post object */ }, { "type":"post", /* ... the rest of the post object */ }, { "type":"post", /* ... the rest of the post object */ }, ] }
docs.title: Response

docs.text: Fetch First Page : curl -X GET http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/authors/123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000/posts/?page=1&size=10 Fetch Second Page : curl -X GET http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/authors/123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000/posts/?page=2&size=10
docs.title: Examples

docs.text: Use this endpoint to create a new post. Useful for authors to share content.
docs.title: When to Use

docs.text: Send a POST request to the endpoint with the AUTHOR_ID in the URL. Include the post data in the request body. The user must be authenticated as the author.
docs.title: How to Use

docs.text: To add new content to the platform.
docs.title: Why to Use

docs.text: URL Parameters : AUTHOR_ID : UUID of the author (e.g., 123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000 ). Body : { "text": "New Post", "visibility": "PUBLIC", "contentType": "text/plain" }
docs.title: Request

docs.text: Status Code : 201 Created (success), 400 Bad Request (invalid data), 403 Forbidden (unauthorized user). Body : { "type":"post", "title":"plain text post", "id":"http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/authors/123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000/posts/123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174011", "page": "http://127.0.0.1:8000/authors/123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000/posts/123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174011", "description":"plain text post", "contentType":"text/plain", "content":"New Post", "author":{ "type":"author", "id":"http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/authors/123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000", "host":"http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/", "displayName":"Test User", "page":"http://127.0.0.1:8000/authors/123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000", "github": "https://github.com/testuser", "profileImage": "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/authors/123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000/posts/123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174010/image" }, "published":"2015-03-09T13:07:04+00:00", "visibility":"PUBLIC" }
docs.title: Response

docs.text: Successful Creation : curl -X POST http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/authors/123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000/posts/ -H "Authorization: Token <auth_token>" -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"text": "New Post", "visibility": "PUBLIC"}'
docs.title: Examples
6. Get a Specific Post by FQID

docs.text: Use this endpoint to retrieve the details of a specific post by its FQID.
docs.title: When to Use

docs.text: Send a GET request to the endpoint with the POST_FQID in the URL. If the post is friends-only, the user must be authenticated.
docs.title: How to Use

docs.text: To fetch a single post for display or editing. To verify the existence of a post. To display the post without needing to separately supply the author's identifier.
docs.title: Why to Use

docs.text: URL Parameters : POST_FQID : Fully Qualified ID (FQID) of the post (e.g., http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/authors/123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000/posts/123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174001 ).

docs.title: Examples

docs.text: Use this endpoint to retrieve an image post converted to binary format. It supports both local and remote requests. Returns a 404 Not Found if the specified post is not an image.
docs.title: When to Use

docs.text: Send a GET request to the endpoint with the AUTHOR_ID and POST_ID in the URL. The returned binary data is suitable for rendering in image tags, or for proxying/caching purposes.
docs.title: How to Use

docs.text: To fetch the actual image data of a post when the post represents an image. Useful for displaying images embedded in Markdown or in client applications.
docs.title: Why to Use

docs.text: URL Parameters : AUTHOR_ID : UUID of the author (e.g., 123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000 ). POST_ID : UUID of the image post (e.g., 123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174004 ).
docs.title: Request

docs.text: Status Code : 200 OK (success), 403 Forbidden (friends-only post without authentication), 404 Not Found (post not found).
docs.title: Response

docs.text: Public Post : curl -X GET http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/authors/123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000/posts/123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174004/image/ Response: An HTTP response displaying the image from the image post with uuid = 123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174004 Friends-Only Post (Unauthenticated) : curl -X GET http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/authors/123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000/posts/123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174005/image/ If user is not logged in: Response: { "detail": "Authentication required." } If user is not a friend: Response: { "detail": "You are not friends with the author." } If user is a friend: Response: An HTTP response displaying the image from the image post with uuid = 123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174005
docs.title: Examples
